trans-unit.source: Provides the logic to establish a timer and to wait, asynchronously, for timer's expiration.
This class cannot be inherited.
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] When notified that its timer has expired, a DelayActivity completes its execution.
You can set a time out on the DelayActivity so that your workflow pauses before resuming execution.
You specify the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.DelayActivity.TimeoutDuration%2A> using <xref:System.TimeSpan>.
This causes your workflow to pause until the specified <xref:System.TimeSpan> has elapsed.

The DelayActivity class runs the code method associated with the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.DelayActivity.InitializeTimeoutDuration> event before the activity starts and the code-beside method can be used to initialize the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.DelayActivity.TimeoutDuration%2A> property.
The DelayActivity is guaranteed to complete no sooner than the indicated <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.DelayActivity.TimeoutDuration%2A>.
The delay can take longer because the timer notification might occur some time after the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.DelayActivity.TimeoutDuration%2A> is reached.
One reason for a longer delay is if the workflow is running under high system stress in a server environment.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.DelayActivity"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.DelayActivity"></xref> class using the name of the activity.
The user-defined name of the activity.

Occurs before the time-out duration starts.
This event should not be used to set the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.DelayActivity.TimeoutDuration%2A> for a <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.DelayActivity>.
The time-out duration should be set in the workflow's `InitializeComponent` method instead.
To be added.
Represents the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> that targets the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.DelayActivity.InitializeTimeoutDuration"></xref> event.
To be added.
To be added.
Gets the name of the workflow queue that will be delivered when the timer expires.
The name of the workflow queue is set by the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueuingService.CreateWorkflowQueue%2A> method.
The name of the workflow queue.
Creates the subscription of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.DelayActivity"></xref> to an event.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext"></xref> that represents the execution environment of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref>.
The <xref:System.EventHandler> for the parent event.
parentContext or parentEventHandler is .
Cancels the subscription of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.DelayActivity"></xref> to an event.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext"></xref> that represents the execution environment of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref>.
The <xref:System.EventHandler> for the parent event.
parentContext or parentEventHandler is .
To be added.
To be added.
Gets and sets the duration of the delay in the workflow.
The time period set in this property determines the time the workflow will sit idle before the workflow proceeds to the next activity.
A <xref:System.TimeSpan> that indicates the length of the delay in the workflow.
Represents the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> that targets the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.DelayActivity.TimeoutDuration*> property.
To be added.
